Hi all - 

One of the now-famous "Chinese" Japanese swords came to me for o=
pinion this week. Talking to the fellow prior to the visit, I felt he had t=
o be describing a "ringer." You wouldn't believe what he all saw in that sw=
ord and how excited he was about this "ancient" sword! I did ask if he want=
ed "the truth" about if when he came over, and he said yes. It took a coupl=
e hours and some show-and-tell to convince him. (He swore some Japanese off=
ered him $10K for this sword six months back!) 

My question here today...t=
his sword had the typical "etched" hada that you could see from across the =
room. Has anyone figured out if these swords are being actually "forged and=
 acid etched" or if this so-called "hada" is applied and etched (probably s=
imilar to fake damascus)? I couldn't say one way or the other 100% but susp=
ect it is "applied." The nakago looked raw and certainly not something that=
 even a blacksmith would make. Odd kanji, etc., and unfinished. 

Comments?=


Ron
STL
